meanings.definition: To make something appear larger than it is.
meanings.sent1: Using a magnifying glass can magnify small objects for better visibility.
meanings.sent2: She used a telescope to magnify the distant stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The magnifying mirror made her eye look enormous!
meanings.sent4: His smile magnified the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes magnify the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To increase the importance or reputation of something.
meanings.sent1: A sincere thank you can magnify the impact of a kind gesture.
meanings.sent2: The award ceremony aimed to magnify the achievements of talented individuals.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated praise only served to magnify his own ego.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to charity work magnifies her standing in the community.
meanings.sent5: The supportive crowd's cheers magnify the athlete's confidence.

meanings.sent1: Don't magnify the size of the fish you caught; be honest!
meanings.sent2: She tends to magnify her problems, making them seem insurmountable.
meanings.sent3: His tall tales always magnify the adventures he claims to have had.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech aimed to magnify the impact of his opponent's mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller's animated voice magnified the excitement of the tale.
